question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Which institution was Huseyin Balci in 2017?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

Title: The Academic Pursuits of Huseyin Balci: A Testament to Dedication and Excellence

In the heart of Kocaeli, Turkey, lies the esteemed Gebze Institute of Technology, a beacon of academic excellence and innovation. It is here that our story unfolds, one that delves into the remarkable career of Huseyin Balci, a researcher whose contributions to the scientific community have left an indelible mark. As we delve into the archives of Gebze Institute of Technology, we find ourselves surrounded by the echoes of academic rigor and intellectual curiosity. It is within these hallowed halls that Huseyin Balci spent a significant portion of his career, leaving behind a trail of groundbreaking research and inspiring a new generation of scholars. One of the earliest records of Balci's association with Gebze Institute of Technology dates back to the early 2000s, when he joined the faculty as a young researcher. His initial foray into the academic world was marked by a series of publications in reputable journals, showcasing his expertise in his chosen field. These early works not only demonstrated his mastery of complex theoretical concepts but also hinted at a deeper understanding of the practical applications that would become a hallmark of his research. As Balci's reputation grew, so did his involvement with the institute. He soon found himself at the forefront of several high-profile research projects, collaborating with colleagues from diverse disciplines to tackle some of the most pressing challenges of the time. It was during this period that he developed a keen interest in interdisciplinary approaches, recognizing the immense potential for innovation that lay at the intersection of seemingly disparate fields. One such project, funded by the Turkish government, aimed to develop sustainable solutions for the country's burgeoning energy crisis. Balci's team, comprising experts from engineering, economics, and environmental science, worked tirelessly to design and implement novel systems that would reduce Turkey's reliance on fossil fuels. The project's success was a testament to Balci's ability to bring together diverse stakeholders and facilitate meaningful collaboration. As the years passed, Balci's contributions to Gebze Institute of Technology continued to grow. He took on leadership roles, guiding teams of researchers and mentoring students who would go on to become leading experts in their own right. His dedication to the institute was matched only by his passion for knowledge, driving him to explore new areas of research and push the boundaries of human understanding.
content.source_2:
Here is a potential Wikipedia entry for Huseyin Balci:

Huseyin Balci

Huseyin Balci is a Turkish-Canadian researcher and scientist who has made significant contributions to the field of cancer research. Born on February 12, 1995, in Istanbul, Turkey, Balci moved to Canada in 2015 to pursue his higher education. Education and Early Career

Balci earned his Bachelor of Science degree in Biochemistry from the University of Toronto in 2019. During his undergraduate studies, he worked as a research assistant in the laboratory of Dr. Maria Rodriguez, where he contributed to several projects focused on cancer cell biology. After completing his undergraduate degree, Balci went on to pursue his Ph.D. in Cancer Biology at the University of British Columbia. His graduate research, supervised by Dr. John Taylor, focused on the development of novel therapeutic strategies for treating pancreatic cancer. Career at BC Cancer Agency

In 2029, Balci joined the BC Cancer Agency, a leading Canadian cancer centre, as a research scientist. During his tenure at the agency, he worked closely with a team of researchers and clinicians to develop and implement innovative cancer treatments. One of Balci's most notable contributions during this period was his work on a collaborative project with Dr. Sophia Patel, a renowned oncologist, to develop a personalized neoantigen-based vaccine for treating lung cancer. The project, funded by the Canadian Institutes of Health Research, aimed to improve treatment outcomes for patients with advanced lung cancer. In 2031, Balci's team published a seminal paper in the journal Nature Medicine, detailing the results of their phase I clinical trial. The study demonstrated significant improvements in patient survival rates and quality of life, paving the way for further research into personalized cancer therapies. Awards and Honors

Balci's contributions to cancer research have been recognized with several awards and honors. In 2032, he was awarded the prestigious Michael Smith Foundation for Health Research Scholar Award for his outstanding contributions to the field of cancer research. References

* Balci, H., Patel, S., et al. (2031). Personalized neoantigen-based vaccine for treating lung cancer: A phase I clinical trial. Nature Medicine, 27(3), 532-541. doi: 10.1038\/s41591-021-01234-6
* BC Cancer Agency. (2029). Research Team: Huseyin Balci.
